text: South Shore railway station was originally the only intermediate station on the Blackpool and Lytham Railway, at South Shore in Lancashire, England, when it opened in 1863.Branch Line News 1026, 16 September 2006, p.210/06, Branch Line Society, Epsom, accessed via Google cache 17 October 2007 In 1903 it was renamed Lytham Road.Hartley, S. and Mitchell, L. (2005) , Lancashire County Council Environment Directorate, accessed 30 October 2007, p.23 In that same year the express Marton Line from Kirkham was built with a new Waterloo Road railway station at its junction with the Lytham line. The new station was just north of Lytham Road station, whose days were then numbered, closing in 1916. ==References== Category:Disused railway stations in Blackpool Category:Former Preston and Wyre Joint Railway stations Category:Railway stations in Great Britain opened in 1863 Category:Railway stations in Great Britain closed in 1916 Category:1863 establishments in England Category:1916 disestablishments in England
